column4: Albemarle's claim to unique lithium technology draws scrutiny
column5: NEWPORT BEACH  Calif./SANTIAGO  Nov 7 Albemarle Corp's claim to have developed a unique process that would more than triple its lithium production from Chile's Atacama desert without using more water is drawing increased scrutiny from regulators and investors pushing for more details.

column4: Former Intel CEO Brian Krzanich to head CDK Global
column5: CDK Global Inc  on Wednesday named Brian Krzanich as its new chief executive officer and president  more than four months after he resigned from the top job at Intel following a probe that found he had a consensual relationship with an employee.

column4: CORRECTED-Former Intel CEO Brian Krzanich to head CDK Global
column5: Nov 7 CDK Global Inc on Wednesday named Brian Krzanich as its new chief executive officer and president  more than four months after he resigned from the top job at Intel following a probe that found he had a consensual relationship with an employee.

column4: Intel-drafted U.S. data privacy bill would protect firms from fines
column5: Chipmaker Intel Corp  said it is seeking a sponsor in Congress for a U.S. data privacy bill it drafted that would shield companies from fines if they attest to the U.S. Federal Trade Commission annually that they take strong measures to protect consumer data.

column4: Qualcomm forecast falls short as Apple sales disappear
column5: Qualcomm Inc  forecast sales revenue for the holiday shopping quarter below analysts' estimates on Wednesday as it took a hit from the loss of chip sales to Apple Inc   sending its shares down 3.4 percent.

column4: UPDATE 4-Qualcomm forecast falls short as Apple sales disappear
column5: Nov 7 Qualcomm Inc forecast sales revenue for the holiday shopping quarter below analysts' estimates on Wednesday as it took a hit from the loss of chip sales to Apple Inc  sending its shares down 3.4 percent.

Nov 7 Qualcomm Inc reported a loss in its fourth quarter on Wednesday  hurt by litigation expenses from its patent battles with customers including Apple Inc and a termination fee related to its collapsed NXP Semiconductors NV deal.

column4: Apple not in settlement talks 'at any level' with Qualcomm: source
column5: Apple Inc  is not in talks "at any level" to settle its wide-ranging legal dispute with mobile chip maker Qualcomm Inc   according to a source familiar with the matter.

column4: UPDATE 1-Apple not in settlement talks 'at any level' with Qualcomm -source
column5: Nov 7 Apple Inc is not in talks "at any level" to settle its wide-ranging legal dispute with mobile chip maker Qualcomm Inc  according to a source familiar with the matter.
